articles.title: Pay transparency is now law in Massachusetts. What does it mean for you?
articles.description:
A new statewide rule makes salaries visible in job postings. Here’s a breakdown for workers and employers.

The post Pay transparency is now law in Massachusetts. What does it mean for you? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Massachusetts enacts pay transparency law effective November 11, 2025, requiring salary disclosures in job postings.
Employers must include salary ranges in listings, impacting hiring practices across various industries.
Workers gain clearer insights into compensation, promoting equitable pay and informed job decisions.

articles.title: A tattoo artist found herself in an unexpected role in Maine’s Senate race
articles.description:
“I didn’t really want necessarily so many people to be talking about this,” artist Mischa Ostberg said of the tattoo. “The important thing is that people are talking about, this movement.”

The post A tattoo artist found herself in an unexpected role in Maine’s Senate race appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Tattoo artist Mischa Ostberg became involved in Maine's Senate race due to a controversial tattoo cover-up.
Ostberg emphasized the importance of discussing the movement against hate symbols in her work.
Her actions may influence local conversations about hate and representation in Boston and beyond.

articles.title: Salem woman who ran ‘creepy creations’ shop to plead guilty in Harvard morgue scandal
articles.description:
Katrina Maclean was accused of storing and selling stolen human remains out of her Peabody store. She recently signed a plea deal with prosecutors.

The post Salem woman who ran ‘creepy creations’ shop to plead guilty in Harvard morgue scandal appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Katrina Maclean will plead guilty for selling stolen human remains from her Peabody shop.
The plea deal follows accusations related to Harvard's morgue scandal involving human remains.
Local residents express concern over the ethical implications of the case in the community.

articles.title: The young women grappling with an ‘old man’s disease’
articles.description:
Diagnosed with ALS, they traded stories, drank tequila, and made grim jokes at a unique annual gathering on Cape Cod.

The post The young women grappling with an ‘old man’s disease’ appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Young women with ALS gathered on Cape Cod for support and camaraderie.
The annual event fosters community among those diagnosed, highlighting the disease's impact on younger individuals.
Participants shared experiences, emphasizing the need for awareness and resources in Boston.

articles.title: Tell us: What’s the best New England town for a winter weekend getaway?
articles.description:
Help a fellow traveler out and share your recommendation.

The post Tell us: What’s the best New England town for a winter weekend getaway? appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Boston residents are encouraged to share winter getaway recommendations for New England towns.
The discussion aims to highlight popular destinations for winter weekends among locals.
Engaging in this conversation may enhance community travel experiences and local tourism.
